sentences.english: Is it true that lack of iodine really causes brain damage?
sentences.chinese: 缺碘是否真的会造成脑损伤？

sentences.english: Sad feeling like what's missing, sour, as if the lack of soul.
sentences.chinese: 心痛的感觉就像少了什么，酸酸的，仿佛缺了灵魂。

sentences.english: The only thing missing is a noose.
Full Moon tonight and tomorrow night on the natural vacancy.
sentences.chinese: 今夜月圆，明夜自然月缺。

sentences.english: We are always shorthanded on Sundays.
sentences.chinese: 我们总是在星期天缺人手。

sentences.english: The moon dims or shines; it waxes or wanes. Nothing is perfect, not even in the olden days.
sentences.chinese: 月有阴晴圆缺，既使在古代也没有完美的事情。

sentences.english: Objective To study the influence factors influencing thyroid volume in school children in iodine-deficient region.
sentences.chinese: 目的探讨缺碘地区学龄儿童甲状腺容积的影响因素。

sentences.english: Two pages are missing from this book.
That is, when either you or the boss is new to the job -- err on the side of giving your boss too much information and asking too many questions。
sentences.chinese: 为老板提供信息和向老板提出问题都要宁滥勿缺。

sentences.english: Outgunned, outnumbered, but now fighting back.
Outgunned, outnumbered, but now fighting back.
People may have many diseases because of lacking of selenium.
sentences.chinese: 缺硒会使人体产生多种疾病。

sentences.english: The photosynthesis and the azotaseactivity were decreased in Mo deficient soybean.
sentences.chinese: 缺钼大豆的光合作用和固氮酶活性降低。

sentences.english: Secondly, most areas of our country lack of it and suggested we should supply it like element I.
sentences.chinese: 我国大部分地区缺硒，并提出要像抓补碘一样抓补硒。

sentences.english: A word or two is missing here.
Do you believe that if you follow me, you will lack nothing?
sentences.chinese: 如果你追随上帝，你将什么都不会缺，你相信吗？

definition: to be deficient in sth/to be short of sth (supplies, money etc)
always/at all times/never (if used in negative sentence)
enough (sufficient)/enough (too much)/(coll.) (before adj.) really/(coll.) to reach by stretching out
very short of (food, clean water etc)/extreme shortage/deficit
poor/destitute/to use up/to exhaust/thoroughly/extremely/(coll.) persistently and pointlessly
only/just (i.e. it is only that...)/all except/unique
few/less/to lack/to be missing/to stop (doing sth)/seldom
The cleverest housewife cannot cook without rice (idiom); You won't get anywhere without equipment.
pinyin: qiao3 fu4 nan2 wei2 wu2 mi3 zhi1 chui1
